intro: Phyllanthus pervilleanus var. glaber, commonly known as the smooth phyllanthus, is a shrub native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It typically grows to a height of 1 to 2 meters, featuring woody stems and simple, alternate leaves that are usually elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by spherical, fleshy fruits containing numerous seeds. It is often found in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. The leaves and fruits are sometimes used in traditional medicine for their potential health benefits.
